context: Something smells here. Was there no one else in the building? I know it was live-streamed but usually there are other people in the congregation even while it is being streamed. These robbers only went for the pastor and his wife? I think there's more to this story we're not hearing.
Isn't that the pastor who inflated the value of his jewelry, I'm glad they were caught but stop being so flashy, God don't like flashy.
Upon reading the headline my first thought was who robs a Pastor during services? But, after reading more, who has a million dollars worth of jewelry? Must have a very generous congregation.
The "Pastor" should be behind bars as well. Organized Religion = Organized Crime.

Straight out of the movie “Honk for Jesus.”  Why would parishioners attend this church or support this man and his wife?  They’re as far from Christ’s teaching as possible.  Goes into the category of false leaders and prophets.
That is what religion is all about-money.  Glad to not be hooked on that scam.
Did the thieves get his 30 pieces of silver?

Miller-Whitehead, known for a flashy persona that includes expensive jewelry and travel in his Rolls Royce, is a friend of New York City Mayor Eric Adams. This is why the suspects are not eligible for no-bail release.

Christians are known by their "fruits".  It looks like this pastor loves worldly goods more than most christians do.  Expensive jewelry, drives a Rolls Royce?  Sounds to me like he's spending contributions on himself instead of helping those in need.  Beware of these false teachers, who don't practice what they preach.
A million dollars of jewelry on him? Pastors of the 13% are usually more corrupt than politicians. The names of the guys who robbed him made me laugh out loud. Figures
I read this story some time back. Odd that a true man of God would be so vane and hold jewelry in such high esteem and posses so little charity. I hope he gets none of it back.
Thieves robbing thieves. Maybe they will work it out during their next BLM meeting.
Released on $50,000 bail. Which means he will only have to pay $5,000.
I wonder why this never happens where I worship.

replies.context: I suppose you aren’t tithing enough for your pastor to have a million in jewelry
I don't tithe.  I give according to my prosperity (1 Corinthians 16:2).  My preacher makes his money on rental property.  But there's another reason that people don't try to rob us.
Hopefully it's because your Pastor is a true man of God not caught up in worldly possessions and has a sense of charity.

We don't have a pastor we have a preacher.  He IS a man of God and has a very modest living.   There is another reason that people don't commit armed robbery at my Church, though, and it has nothing to do with our worldly possessions.  Well, except for one thing that most of us own and carry to Church with us.
